Firrst Electrical job I was on as a helper in 1976 was to pick up a pole th=
at was to feeding a house someone had wired in aluminum that had burned to =
the ground due to a bad connection it had just been built. I had been with =
my old man on a many job sinhce I was 8 and never had seen anything like th=
at. Copper is the only way to gold only better conductor is Gold. but who c=
an handle that in a house. worste case of emf I have ever seen was a fancy =
chandaler that someone had over sized bulbs in and that thing flared up the=
 whole house to very dangerous levels. when they say 60 watt max they mean =
it for your own safety. this thing had around 10 100 watt bulbs in it and t=
he emfs were causing all kinds of nice images after 30 minutes in the house=
 we were having them too. 


=A0
http://www.myspace.com/ghost_hunter50
see =
my site links

--- On Wed, 5/27/09, SnowfireL@... <SnowfireL@...> w=
rote:


From: SnowfireL@... <SnowfireL@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] =
Electrical Question
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Wednesday, May 27, 20=
09, 8:47 AM









copper is a great conductor
=A0

In a message dated 5/=
27/2009 9:44:02 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time, w9sz.zack@gmail. com writes:


=





Aluminum wire is a nightmare! The stuff tends to=A0overheat, oxidizes =
where interconnections are made and=A0will spark, etc. 
=A0
I bought a tran=
sformer at Gateway Electronics in St. Louis=A0some years ago that looked li=
ke a great transformer for a high-current 12 volt supply. The secondary app=
eared to be wound with #8 enameled wire. I found out the secondary was woun=
d with aluminum wire.=A0After I built the power supply and tried to get 20 =
amps from it but couldn't, I gave up on it and got another transformer woun=
d with copper wire.

Zack

=A0
On Wed, May 27, 2009 at 8:16 AM, Frank Sumpt=
ion <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com> wrote:









=A0We have a touch lamp th=
at comes on by itself, and we have electric matress heaters that make a cli=
cking noise in the radio when the controller is on. When the furnace comes =
on, it affects the boxes, and--when=A0I first started doign EVP recordings =
with white noise, if the=A0furnace happened to come on when I was recording=
 a voice would report "it's on fire!".
=A0
=A0What if that house has alumin=
um wire?
=A0
=A0Frank-S



On Tue, May 26, 2009 at 5:15 PM, April Abercromb=
ie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:









Thanks! Would tha=
t account for the tapping noise?
=A0


----- Original Message ----- 
From: =
Rj 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 

Sent: Tuesday, May 26, 2009 4:07 PM
Subj=
ect: Re: [EVP-ITC] Electrical Question








Yes.=A0 Also faulty wiring, =
which is even more dangerous.
Also with flakey transformers or other power =
distribution in the area, or power lines.
Perhaps you can check with some n=
eighbors, and see how their power is doing.


--- On Tue, 5/26/09, April Ab=
ercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


From: April Aberc=
rombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Electrical=
 Question
To: "EVP-ITC Group" <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com>
Date: Tuesday, May=
 26, 2009, 2:52 PM





Hi All,
=A0
Is there someone here that can answer a=
nd electrical question for me?
=A0
During the case that I recorded those po=
ssible EVP's-there was a loud tapping noise that seemed to come from the 2n=
d bedroom. Upon checking my logs, every time one of=A0 these clicks were he=
ard, there would be an EMF spike in the livingroom. The 2nd bedroom is upst=
airs, the livingroom downstairs. The home owners have also reported that th=
ey have a touch lamp that comes on all the time by itself and the lights in=
 the Kitchen will dim occasionally.
=A0
Now these taps are not consistent i=
n timing, loudness or rhythm. Could this be the work of faulty breakers?
=
=A0
Thanks!
April
